entry.title: Re: Payment is NOT debatching - Reprocess Bank Statement...
entry.content:
Hi @JENN93 ,

Pl. explore below options.

AreaCitibank (Working)HSBC (Issue)Action / Check
Bank Statement File ContentCAMT.053 / BAI2 file includes line-item details (<NtryDtls> or equivalent) per vendorFile appears to include batch-level only, no vendor-level granularityCompare raw bank statement files side by side
MBC MappingMapped to capture End-to-End ID / vendor referencePossibly mapped only at batch header levelAdjust mapping in MBC Mapping Cockpit
Posting Rules (Manage Posting Rules App)Posting algorithms split entries by reference/vendorPosting algorithm may use only header dataAssign algorithm like 019 (Reference) or 029 (End-to-End ID)
Clearing Rules (Manage Bank Statement Rules App)Rules defined per Payment Reference ‚Üí results in debatchingMissing or not splitting by vendor referenceDefine rule to split by reference / End-to-End ID
Payment ID UniquenessEach payment has unique End-to-End IDHSBC may not provide unique IDs per vendorRequest HSBC to enrich file with detailed End-to-End IDs
System Result in Reprocess Bank Statement AppVendor-level items visible and cleared separatelyLump-sum batch shown, no vendor splitFix depends on file enrichment + mapping/rules

Summary:-
-Citibank files contain line-item details ‚Üí debatching works. HSBC files likely only have batch headers ‚Üí no split in Reprocess Bank Statement tile.
-Fix = check file structure, adjust MBC mapping + posting/clearing rules, or request HSBC to provide enriched ACH statements.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback. Used GenAI
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Document Grounding: A (hidden) gem in SAP Business AI‚Äôs portfolio for smaller companies.
entry.content:
Smaller organisations typically want to have a small entry level cost to get started with any new investments.  Document grounding AI feature from SAP has a commercial structure to support this. Together with the free Joule Base I believe document grounding is a great opportunity for SAP's partners to introduce SAP Business AI to ALL their customers (also the small customers), and to ALL the users to quickly get benefit, at an extremely reasonable price.

What is document grounding?

Are you are familiar with the ‚Äúinformational‚Äù pattern in Joule?   A user can ask Joule about how something works in their SAP system.  Joule gives answer based on the knowledge on the SAP Help Portal.  This is made possible by the fact that SAP has already  ‚Äúgrounding‚Äù Joule with the information on the help portal and then using this information to formulate an answer to queries of users, leveraging LLMs.  Some people describe this as ‚Äútraining Joule‚Äù.   Technically this is probably not the correct term, but it gives a good idea of what it is.

What if a company could ‚Äútrain‚Äù Joule to answer any questions related to their customer specific situation?  This is possible with ‚Äúdocument grounding‚Äù.   SAP customers can ‚Äúupload‚Äù their own documents with important information about how they work, and Joule can be ‚Äútrained‚Äù to answer user questions on these informations. 

What are examples on how companies can use document grounding?

  • HR policies: most companies have documents describing their policies regarding vacation, travel, car policy, expense policies etc.  Joule can be grounded on these documents and serve as basis for users to get answer to their queries.
  • Working instructions: most companies have special instructions on how to work in the SAP system.  For example, specific ways to do month end processes, how to book a purchase invoice to split cost over departments, which specific G/L account to use for special bookings, special business rules for specific suppliers etc.  These working instruction documents can be including in document grounding for Joule.
  • Product information: one example I heard about was a company with a huge list of product SKU with interdependencies which they grounded into Joule so that salespeople could use Joule to answer their questions about best product fit for a customer.
  • The opportunities are endless.  If an SAP customer has any written documents their users need to consult now and then, these documents are candidates for document grounding in Joule.   I recommend SAP partners to brainstorm about this with their customers.

Here is an example of a user leveraging Joule to query their company‚Äôs specific documents.  The answer is obviously not based on SAP help portal information, but on a specific customer HR policy document:

How much does document grounding cost?

There are two cost elements:  First, the ‚Äútraining‚Äù of Joule; uploading, indexing, and storing the indexed information in the right format for Joule to use it.  

Secondly, every time the user query the documents via Joule, Joule leverages LLMs to put together the answer.  The good news: since June this year this is now part of ‚Äúinformational‚Äù pattern in Joule Base and thus free for customers running a SAP LOB solution where Joule is support, as I wrote about in another article.

Let‚Äôs look at an example for the indexing cost:  A company has 40 documents they want to include in document grounding.  Each document is 50mb large.  This will cost 16.80 euro per year.  You read it correctly: 16.80 euro, less than 17 euro!!  (we are NOT talking about 16.8K).    This cost includes the initial indexing and constant reindexing when the customer makes changes to the documents.

Here are the detailed calculations:  Document grounding is a premium transactional AI feature.  The pricing is 0,005 AI units per record per month (for practical purposes, a record is up to 50Mb of documents).  As the list price of 100 AI units is 700 (thus 7 euro per 1 AI unit), this would be the full calculation:

40 records * 0.005 AI units * 7 euro per AI unit * 12 months = 16.80 Euro

The core pricing  information for this calculation can be found in the SAP AI Features Guide Price List :

How can a customer get going with document grounding?

  • Order Joule base and get it up and running.  Read more
  • Purchase at least 100 AI units.  Even though the example above only needs 2.4 AI units for a whole year, the minimum purchase requirement for SAP AI units is 100 units (with a list price of 700 euro in Europe). 
  • Understand the document ground technical product requirements. Main point here is the requirement of where the customer store and manage their documents in the first place (MS SharePoint or SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition). 

Can partner test and demo document grounding in their TDD systems?

No, not right now.  However, it will become possible at the end of October 2025 when SAP will launch a special AI unit for TDD.

For more information about document grounding, check the AI feature catalog  (tip: toggle to the second image in the image box and play the demo video).   Please also have a look at pages 15-16 the official SAP L3 deck on Joule.

entry.title: Re: The Complete Guide to Calling Actions in UI5 with Custom Code
entry.content:
I was struggling for a while to call a static RAP action behind a v4 service.

RAP does not have unbound actions (because you can declare actions only inside a behaviour so by definition they are always bound). But it does have static actions (so you can call them without passing a single entity as a parameter).

Maybe this can be added to the guide to make it truly complete @Marian_Zeis 

You have to create a context for the entity collection itself and then pass this context to invoke action. Otherwise the framework will not find your static function. For the function name make sure to use the full qualified name (with the service qualifier as a prefix).

const oExtensionAPI = this.base.getExtensionAPI();
const oModel = oExtensionAPI.getModel();
const oContext = oModel.bindContext("/EntityContainerWhereActionIsDefined");
try {
    const oEditFlow = oExtensionAPI.getEditFlow();
    await oEditFlow.invokeAction("com.sap.gateway.srvd.zmy_service.v0001.MyStaticAction", {
        contexts: oContext
    });
} catch (oError) {
    // handle error
}

entry.title: Re: Bpay Biller code and CRN capture in SAP for Accounts...
entry.content:
Hi @priyalizthomas @Alister07 ,

Pl. explore below options.

 

StepAreaTransaction / ObjectAction / SettingNotes
1Payment Method SetupFBZP ‚Üí Payment Method in CountryCreate new payment method ‚ÄúBP‚Äù (BPay)Suppress IBAN/Bank Account checks since BPay does not use them
2Payment Method per Company CodeFBZP ‚Üí Payment Method in Company CodeAssign method ‚ÄúBP‚Äù to company codeAllow ‚ÄúOutgoing payments‚Äù only
3Vendor Master DataBP / XK02Add fields for Biller Code and CRNOption A: Custom fields (preferred) Option B: Reuse Bank Key = Biller Code & Bank Account Number = CRN
4Invoice ReferenceFB60 / F-43Enter CRN in Reference field (XBLNR)Use if CRN changes per invoice
5Payment Medium FormatDMEE (Payment Medium Workbench)Create / copy format tree for BPayReplace bank details nodes with Biller Code + CRN
6Field Mapping in DMEEDMEE Tree MaintenanceMap fields: ‚Äì Biller Code ‚Üí Vendor Master (custom or Bank Key) ‚Äì CRN ‚Üí Invoice Reference (XBLNR) or Vendor MasterEnsures correct output to payment file
7House Bank SetupFI12Optional: Define House Bank for BPayOnly if required by bank file structure
8Payment RunF110Run payment program with method ‚ÄúBP‚ÄùFile will generate with Biller Code + CRN instead of bank details
9File TransferBank Connectivity (MBC/BCM)Upload payment file to bankFormat must match BPay standard

Summary:-
-Biller Code = Vendor ID in BPay ‚Üí usually fixed per vendor.
-CRN = Your reference with vendor ‚Üí may be fixed or vary per invoice.
-If same vendor uses both EFT & BPay, use custom fields instead of reusing Bank Key/Account.
-DMEE is critical ‚Üí it decides whether bank details are replaced with BPay fields.

entry.title: Re: Impact of a U.S. Federal Government Shutdown on E-Verify
entry.content:
The shutdown has indeed occurred, this is no longer an "if" scenario. I will continue to provide updates here as they come in.

From the E-Verify service directly, I've received confirmation that their service is affected:

E-Verify is not available due to a lapse in Department of Homeland Security appropriations and due to a lapse in statutory authority for the E-Verify program. While E-Verify is unavailable, employers cannot access their E-Verify accounts. Customer support services are also unavailable.

Employers must continue to complete and retain Form I-9, Employment Eligibility Verification, within the required time for every person hired to work for pay in the United States.

Employers using an alternative procedure authorized by DHS to perform a remote examination of employees‚Äô Form I-9 documents may continue to do so if they remain enrolled in good standing in E-Verify during the lapse in DHS appropriations.

Employees cannot resolve E-Verify Tentative Nonconfirmations (mismatches) during this time. Employees with a Social Security Administration mismatch must wait until E-Verify resumes operations to visit an SSA office to resolve their mismatch. 

For more information, please visit E-Verify What‚Äôs New.

We apologize for any inconvenience and appreciate your patience.

entry.title: Re: AI-assisted scoping and configuration services (CBC A...
entry.content:
Integration of AI features with SAP Central Business Configuration, AI-assisted scoping and configuration services (CBC AIX) are activated by an AI unit contract. 

SAP AI Unit License allows the customers to use AI features via AI units. So customers with these licenses will have AI features visible in the Business UI tab and they will be provided access to CBC to activate and deactivate the AI features. Please refer note 3632594 - Information about the upcoming integration of AI features with SAP Central Business Configuration (CBC), activated by an AI unit contract. for more details.

If you have any question about AI unit license, please further contact your SAP sales representative to get the AI Unit license tailored to your business needs.

entry.title: Re: Why asset doest not have material code in SAP ERP?
entry.content:
Hello @nithin_pranesh 

Thank you for your follow-up

If a purchase requisition (PR) is not subsequently converted into a purchase order (PO), the asset created during the PR phase will not be automatically removed; manual deletion or retirement will be required. In a public cloud environment, it is considered best practice to establish an asset shell at the PR stage and subsequently enrich it during the Goods Receipt (GR) or Capitalisation process.

To minimise duplication, it is also advisable to configure automatic asset creation at the PO or GR stage (scope item J62). This approach ensures that comprehensive asset details are captured only when they become available. Refs: Scope Item J62 ‚Äì Asset Acquisition

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to upload Excel Spreadsheet on SAP Fiori UI5 Freestyle
entry.content:
@Saswata89 You need to get rid of the sap.ui.define import in your controller, your using the same variable name "XLSX" as the global "XLSX" name in the library file. This way your local "XLSX" variable will overwrite the global "XLSX" one in the lib with "undefined" üòâ

Refering to the XLSX lib in your Manifest.json will do. If you insist in using sap.ui.define (which I think is even recommended) then at least don't use the same variable name as the global one in the lib itself.

entry.title: Re: Best Practices for SAP Sales Cloud V2 Standalone Setu...
entry.content:
Hi @JendrikT 

We‚Äôve had success running Sales Cloud v2 first, S/4 later by treating S/4 as the master from day one. The key is to:

  • Mirror S/4‚Äôs sales-area structure directly in Sales Cloud v2.
  • Use External ID Mapping early (for org units, accounts, contacts, products) so S/4 keys fit cleanly later.
  • Keep master data lean‚Äîavoid Sales Cloud-only org models or custom fields with no S/4 target.
  • Normalize IDs, code lists, and ISO domains upfront to reduce rework.
  • Do a dry integration test, then cut over by replicating from S/4 and flipping master-data ownership.

We shared our insights in our SSCv2 blog . Hope it helps. Feel free to reach out...

entry.title: Building Custom Authentication in SAP CAP
entry.content:
This guide presenets practical example to implement custom authentication in SAP CAP (Node.js). I hav

Project Setup

Configuration Entry Point

The key to enabling custom authentication in CAP is the auth configuration in package.json. This tells the CAP runtime to use your custom middleware handler for all incoming requests, allowing you to control the identity verification process.

{
  "cds": {
    "requires": {
      "auth": {
        "impl": "auth/basic-auth.ts"
      }
    }
  }
}
 

Implementation: Core Components

1. Security Best Practices

When handling passwords, security must be the top priority. The following code demonstrates secure handling, specifically addressing the timing attack vector, which is often overlooked.

// auth/basic-auth.ts
import crypto from 'crypto';

const PASSWORD_PEPPER = process.env.PASSWORD_PEPPER || ""; 

// Timing-safe comparison prevents timing attacks
function secureCompare(a: string, b: string): boolean {
  // Ensure we compare strings of the same length
  if (a.length !== b.length) return false; 
  // crypto.timingSafeEqual is CRITICAL for password security
  return crypto.timingSafeEqual(Buffer.from(a, 'utf8'), Buffer.from(b, 'utf8'));
}

function hashPassword(password: string): string {
  if (!password) {
    throw new Error("Password cannot be empty");
  }
  // NOTE: SHA-256 is used here ONLY for simplicity in a Basic Auth example.
  // DO NOT use SHA-256 in production. Use bcrypt or argon2.
  return crypto
    .createHash('sha256')
    .update(password + PASSWORD_PEPPER)
    .digest('hex');
}

Key Security Features:

  • crypto.timingSafeEqual(): Guarantees constant-time comparison, preventing attackers from using timing measurements to guess password characters.

  • Password Pepper: An extra layer of security beyond salting.

  • Production Note: In a production system, always use bcrypt or argon2 instead of simple hash functions.

2. Database Schema

The user schema must be designed to support both local password-based authentication (for Basic Auth) and future external OAuth integrations.

// db/schema.cds
entity Users {
  key ID          : UUID;
      email       : String(255) @assert.unique;
      username    : String(100) @assert.unique;
      passwordHash: String(255);
      firstName   : String(100);
      lastName    : String(100);
      provider    : String(50);   // 'local', 'google', 'oidc'
      providerId  : String(255);  // ID from external provider (for OAuth)
      isActive    : Boolean default true;
}

3. Authentication Logic

This core function handles credential verification against the database.

const credentialsAuthentication = async ({ 
  email, 
  password 
}: { 
  email: string, 
  password: string 
}) => {
  const { Users } = cds.entities;
  try {
    // 1. Validate Input
    if (!email || !password) {
      return { success: false, message: "Email and password are required", user: null };
    }
    
    // Normalize email for consistent lookups
    const normalizedEmail = email.trim().toLowerCase();
    
    // 2. Query User
    const user = await SELECT.one
      .from(Users)
      .where({ 
         email: normalizedEmail, 
         isActive: true 
       });
       
    // 3. Security Check: Prevent User Enumeration Attack
    // Use the same error message whether the user is missing or the password is wrong.
    if (!user) {
      return { success: false, message: "Invalid credentials", user: null };
    }
    
    // 4. Secure Password Verification
    const passwordHash = hashPassword(password);
    const isPasswordValid = secureCompare(user.passwordHash, passwordHash); 
    
    if (!isPasswordValid) {
      return { success: false, message: "Invalid credentials", user: null };
    }
          
    return {
      success: true,
      message: 'Login successful',
      user: {
        id: user.ID,
        email: user.email,
        username: user.username,
        firstName: user.firstName,
        lastName: user.lastName,
      }
    };
  } catch (err) {
    cds.log('auth').error('Authentication error:', err);
    return { success: false, message: "Authentication failed", user: null };
  }
}

Key Technical Points:

  • Preventing User Enumeration: Using the generic "Invalid credentials" message.

  • Email Normalization: Ensures query consistency.

4. Express Middleware Integration

The authentication handler is implemented as Express Middleware. It parses the Basic Auth header and creates the essential CAP-compatible user object.

import { Request, Response, NextFunction } from 'express';
import cds from '@sap/cds';
// ... import credentialsAuthentication ... (from section 3)

export default async function custom_auth(
  req: Request, 
  res: Response, 
  next: NextFunction
) {
  try {
    const authHeader = req.headers.authorization;
    
    // Allow requests without Basic Auth header to proceed. 
    if (!authHeader || !authHeader.startsWith('Basic ')) {
      return next();
    }
    
    // Parse Basic Auth header
    const base64Credentials = authHeader.split(' ')[1];
    const credentials = Buffer
      .from(base64Credentials, 'base64')
      .toString('utf-8');
      
    const [email, password] = credentials.split(':', 2);
    
    if (!email?.trim() || !password) {
      res.status(401).json({ error: 'Invalid credentials format' });
      return;
    }
    
    const auth = await credentialsAuthentication({ email, password });
    const { success, user } = auth;
    
    if (success && user) {
      // CRITICAL: Create the CAP-compatible user object
      const roles = user.roles.length > 0 ? user.roles : ['authenticated'];
      
      const capUser = new cds.User({
        id: user.id,
        attr: {
          email: user.email,
          username: user.username,
          firstName: user.firstName,
          lastName: user.lastName
        }
      });
      
      // Set the user context in both CAP and Express
      cds.context.user = capUser;
      req.user = capUser;
      next();
    } else {
      res.status(401).json({ error: auth.message });
    }
  } catch (error) {
    cds.log('auth').error('Unexpected authentication error:', error);
    res.status(401).json({ error: 'Unauthorized' });
  }
}

Critical Implementation Details:

  • The user context must be set in both cds.context.user (for CAP Services) and req.user (for Express-based middleware).

5. Service-Level Authorization

With the custom handler successfully establishing the user context, you can immediately leverage CAP's built-in authorization features:

// srv/test-service.cds
service TestService @(requires: 'authenticated-user') { 
   entity Products as projection on template.Products;
}

Testing Your Implementation

Basic Authentication Test

 

Bash
 
# 1. Base64 encode your credentials (email:password)
echo -n 'john.doe@example.com:password' | base64

# 2. Test the endpoint using the encoded value in the Authorization header
curl -X GET http://localhost:4004/odata/v4/test/Products \
  -H "Authorization: Basic am9obi5kb2VAZXhhbXBsZS5jb206cGFzc3dvcmQ="

Expected: 200 OK with product data.

Unauthorized Access Test

 

Bash
 
# Test without the Authorization header
curl -X GET http://localhost:4004/odata/v4/test/Products

Expected: 401 Unauthorized.

When to Use Custom Authentication vs. Standard SAP Solutions

It's crucial to acknowledge that using XSUAA, IAS (Identity Authentication Service), or standard JWT-based authentication is the recommended and preferred approach for the vast majority of SAP CAP applications. These services offer enterprise-grade security, compliance, and integration with the SAP ecosystem.

However, the SAP CAP intentionally provides mechanisms for custom authentication. This approach is necessary when:

  • B2C Applications: Requiring fully custom registration and login user experiences.

  • Legacy System Migration: Integrating existing applications with established user databases and authentication logic.

If your use case aligns with standard enterprise authentication, you should prioritize XSUAA or IAS. Custom authentication should be a deliberate, technically driven choice.

What's Next?

This guide provides the robust foundation for custom Basic Authentication in SAP CAP. Stay tuned for the next parts of this series, where we will extend this implementation.

The journey continues!

entry.title: üá∏üá¨ Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core (Singapore)
entry.content:
This SAP CodeJam event is on the topic of Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core and Python. You do not need to have any background in the topic, but a lot of curiosity!

In this CodeJam you will learn how to use Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core to implement a retrieval augmented generation (RAG) use case to improve the responses of large language models (LLMs) and reduce hallucinations. You will learn how to deploy an LLM and the orchestration service on SAP AI Core and query it via SAP AI Launchpad and the Python SDK. Furthermore, you will learn about the most important genAI concepts and create and use embeddings to improve your RAG response and build your own chatbot with memory.

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Thursday, November 20th, 2025 at the SAP office in Singapore from 09:00 - 15:00 local time. The language of the event and the content will be English. 

30 Pasir Panjang Roa
#03-32 Mapletree Business City
Singapore 117440
Phone+65 6664 6868

Prerequisites: Any Chromium-based web browser, such as Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, etc.

Please note that spaces are limited - we can only accommodate 18 attendees. Register here in the Community Event using the RSVP functionality.

For more information on SAP CodeJam events, to ask questions, and to chat with your fellow attendees, head over to the SAP CodeJam group.

Hello Daniel,

Thank you for the great blog!

Yes,A system rename will be performed as part of the process if we go with VM clone approach.

The other approach which is to perform a heterogeneous system copy by migrating the MS SQL database on Windows to an S/4HANA environment on Linux(one of the use case).

After the copy, all clients except 000 will be deleted. Next, we will perform a remote client copy from the source ECC system (e.g., productive client 100) to the corresponding newly created client 100 in the ECC shell system using SAP_CUST profile.

Finally, an S/4HANA conversion will be executed on this shell system to achieve the final target Shell S/4 Hana build.

Hope the understanding is correct.

entry.title: SAP Community Voice: New Enhancements, Developers Forums and Kick-off Events for SAP TechEd!
entry.content:
The month of September is over, but let‚Äôs take time to give a shoutout for all the great things this month brought to our SAP Community! More than 10 new platform features and enhancements, fresh new Blog Badges, the comeback of Developer Forums, and insightful content from our members. We‚Äôve also hit a new milestone with 50K YouTube subscribers, and we would like to show our gratitude to everyone who continues to contribute and grow with us.

And to give you even more inspiration and reasons to connect with other members, we are celebrating and sharing all the information about the start of Devtoberfest and announcements for SAP TechEd on Tour (including the opportunity to become Community Talk Speaker for SAP TechEd on Tour in Bangalore!).

Read more below to find out what‚Äôs happening in and around SAP Community!

Featured Content

Simplified Journey with ALM and Integrated Toolchain Themes

Whether you are beginner or looking to reinforce your knowledge about SAP Cloud ALM, this step-by-step post by SAP¬¥s @lealmeida, will for sure give you all the core features, background on integrated toolchain comprising powerful solutions and possible outcomes. Additionally, this content includes SAP Activate Methodology, to provide structured guidance for implementing SAP solutions effectively. Full of great resources, we highly encourage you to read, try and share your achievements in the comments!

Read the blog post 

Migrating from SAP PO to SAP Integration Suite (CPI) 

The process of migrating from SAP Process Orchestration (PO) to SAP Integration Suite (CPI), sometimes can be very tricky. But, in this step-by-step guide written by @Praveen_Kumar_Beera, you will learn how to connect SAP PO to SAP Cloud Connector, add it in SAP Integration Suite, and import message mappings along with dependent objects such as Imported Archives and Function Libraries. Beyond the technical shift, he made sure to explain how migrating is also an opportunity to modernize integration landscapes, adopt cloud-first patterns, and leverage the flexibility of SAP BTP.  

Read the blog post 

New feature in SAP BTP cockpit 

SAP¬¥s @annikarossel, brought great news with the introduction of Favorites and Recent new feature for the SAP BTP cockpit. Providing faster and efficient access to important resources from everywhere in the cockpit, the main goal is to help you grow your productivity across various accounts, applications and services. Make sure to check the tutorial videos in the blog post, search where you can find these new buttons and give your feedback via the shell bar icon in the cockpit or join the user research survey.

Read the blog post 

SAP TechEd Expert Playlist 

TechEd is right around the corner, and the best way to prepare is organizing yourself to attend the sessions with topics that you are most passionate about. @Marla-Schweiki, SAP community member since 2018 and that has recently joined SAP Mentors program, prepared her Expert Playlist including all the themes and speakers in her favorites list. Be sure to check her selection and get some inspiration to make the most out of your time in Berlin!

Read the blog post 

Community News 

New searching Beta

If you ever struggled on finding a specific topic, event or user on SAP Community platform, we think you probably will enjoy the new Searching Beta feature. Powered by Coveo, this option you can select on the search bar and offers enhanced filtering and federated results across multiple repositories, including‚ÄØSAP.com,‚ÄØSAP Store, and‚ÄØSAP Support Portal There are also new menus that let you filter by specific products and SAP Managed Tags. You can either search for available products and tags or select multiple options. Additionally, the members request has been heard and now it is also possible to filter questions by status (answered, solved, and open). Try the new beta search for yourself, explore around and give your feedback on the comments inside the blog post here.  

Update on Rules of Engagement

Being an active member inside the SAP Community, also comes with the responsibility of following the rules and collaborating for a safe and enjoyable experience for everyone. In September the rules were updated to bring more clarification on participation etiquette, guidelines on publishing content and information on user profile. One of the most important is Article 3, that now has been revised to define what is ‚ÄúUnacceptable Content,‚Äù aligning with the EU‚Äôs Digital Services Act (DSA), and clarifies that job opportunities and postings are no longer permitted in the SAP Community. Please, we highly recommend reading the whole document here and putting effort into following the rules.  

New blog badges

In recognition of all our community bloggers, the full set of blogger badges is now live! If you are an active content creator, you have probably already seen this update and received a notification on your new badge. With milestones ranging from 1 to 30 content published, SAP¬¥s @CaroleighDeneen explained on her latest blog post all the details on the progression set. If you‚Äôd like to get involved with blogging, start by taking our‚ÄØcommunity tutorial‚ÄØand familiarize yourself with ours‚ÄØmoderation policy for blogging.‚ÄØ 

New developers Forums

Many of the members have been looking forward to this and our SAP Community team is thrilled to announce the launch of Developer Forums. Covering topics like ABAP (classic and cloud), AI, SAP CAP, Data & Analytics, HANA, Fiori/UI5, Integration, and Tooling, this is the new home for our developers and technical audience. Perhaps, the forums include threaded replies, a more compact feed for faster browsing, and a filter that many of you have been waiting for: ‚ÄúNo answers‚Äù. The Developer Forums will be running as a pilot for 3 months, SAP will refine the experience based on feedback, so now is the best time to join. So, make sure to read more details on @AnnePetteroe post about the new feature and use the comment section to tell us what you think!  

More Enhancements to SAP Community

As you probably noticed by now, September was remarkable for the number of new enhancements in SAP Community. To make our members experience more smooth and complete, we are happy to launch: 

  • New Standards for Tags and Labels - Enables only 10 SAP Managed Tags, user tags and ten labels per piece of content.  
  • <code> tag - Ability to inline <code> HTML element in the body of a post, which will be displayed its contents styled in a colored monospaced font.  
  • Table of Contents (TOC) - Functionality that allows to add the Table of Contents for blog posts and documents (Knowledge Base articles).  This button will open a ‚ÄúManaged Table of Contents‚Äù to give you a preview and options overview. 
  • Dismissible Global Banner - The team heard our members request and now is possible to find the button ‚ÄúX‚Äù in the banner, which will be removed until a new banner is added. Perhaps, some areas in the platform the banner cannot be removed (e.g.,‚ÄØ"Archived Content" area, where we have permanent banners informing users that content there is set to read-only).  
  • Glow/Dark Mode Fixes ‚Äì Both modes were fixed and now the Label widget has been hidden in some boards, the ‚ÄúBoard‚Äù word has also been removed from the top of the feed (allowing the content to be moved up) and ‚Äúspacing‚Äù around headers in post is fixed. 
  • Date Filter on Feeds - Creation Date‚Äô sorting option has been added to all feeds, making it easier to organize and view posts by when they were created. 

Check more details and images description of each one of these new features here!  

YouTube channel reached 50K 

One of our main social channels has just reached a new milestone! The SAP Community YouTube channel now has more than 50k subscribers. We would like to say thank you to each one of our members who is active in our community and always engages with our videos. You are the reason we keep creating and doing our best to deliver great content. And if you‚Äôre not yet aware of our channel, watch now here, explore our playlists, and subscribe to get notifications every time we upload another cool video! 

Events

Devtoberfest is here!

Built for developers by developers, the Devtoberfest by SAP TechEd has officially started! This first week is full of amazing sessions about ABAP, Tooling & Frontend, Integration, Data & AI, CAP and many fun activities (For more information about the Scavenger Hunt, check Daniel¬¥s post). If you are actively participating, don¬¥t forget to earn your points for the Grand Prize competition, by taking the validation tutorials here. Check the latest blog post by @KevinR for more details on the list of all the points you can earn for each activity. Don¬¥t miss this chance to participate!  

Reminder of TechEd Agenda Builder

The end of the year for our SAP Community also means that we are getting closer to TechEd. Once again, we would like to remind everyone to take the time to build your agenda. Available for both onsite or online attendees, this tool allows you to mix and match the sessions with topics you are most looking forward to watching. Remember:‚ÄØyou need a Full Conference Pass to book Hands-On Workshops and there is a maximum of 2 allowed per attendee. Act now because they fill up fast! Read here more details on how to do it.  

The SAP TechEd on Tour is coming to Sydney!

Calling all our folks from Australia, because the SAP TechEd on Tour is coming to Sydney this year! From the 12 until 14 of November, the ICC Sydney will be hosting one of the biggest learning and networking events for our SAP community. Tracks covering the biggest trend topics, Developer Garage, the presence of SAP Mentors and Champions and much more. Look on this post for more details And if you are part of the Sydney Location group or are planning on visiting the city, make sure to take part!

Call for Community Talk Speakers for SAP TechEd on Tour in Bangalore

Do you love exchanging insights and experience in SAP technologies with others? Then this is your opportunity to become a Community Talk speaker.  For our upcoming SAP TechEd on Tour in Bangalore, happening in November 25-25, we are offering slots for a 20-minute session to showcase your expertise. This is a great opportunity to collaborate and engage with developers, business leaders and expand your reach. The selected speakers get a ‚ÄúLecture-Only‚Äù ticket to attend SAP TechEd (travel and expenses are not covered by SAP). October 10. Is the deadline to submit the application and the notification of acceptance will be sent out on October 17. The final presentation submission for review is on November 10. (but if you are not planning to give a presentation, that is completely fine as well). SAP¬¥s @MynynaChau gave some details on her blog post, make sure to read and find more details on the Topics to Consider and the guide on How to Apply. 

Highlights of SAP Inside Tracks

Finally, we would like to recognize the amazing effort our SAP Community has put into the SAP Inside Track¬¥s that happened in September. Congratulations to all event organizers and volunteers at SAP Inside Track Philadelphia, SAP Inside Track Hamburg, SAP Inside Track Porto, SAP SIT RS (Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil) . and many other meetups around the world. Stay tuned to our YouTube channel, where we‚Äôll soon be uploading exclusive content to give you a closer look and inspire you to attend upcoming events in your area!

entry.title: Re: Subject: How to Register Memo-like Items in Sales BOM...
entry.content:
Hello @QinDongqiang 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, the BOM Text Item (Item Category T) is solely for documentation and, by design, is not included in sales orders. This is standard behaviour. SAP Help ‚Äì BOM Item Categories Text items are used for documentation in the BOM and do not result in components in subsequent processing

SAP KBA-3591159 - Issue with Sales BOM Text Items in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

If memo-like lines are to appear in the sales order, the supported options include:

Use a dummy service material with an item category set as non-stock / non-pricing / non-billing so it transfers as an order line but has no process impact, and use text determination to pull BOM long texts into the sales order header or item text. BOM Item Long Text-SAP Help

In short, Text Items (T) cannot be exploded into SD documents; dummy materials or text determination are the valid approaches

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Automatic sending of SalesOrder messages from the S/4...
entry.content:
Hello @MichaelSeydler 

Thank you for the details. You‚Äôre nearly done. Here are the final steps in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, to ensure Sales Order events are delivered to your Event Mesh queue:

Configure or confirm SAP_COM_0092 ‚Äì Business Event Handling and direct it to your existing Communication System (OAuth 2.0 client from your Event Mesh message client)

Enterprise Event Enablement (EEE)
In the EEE apps:

Create a channel (type: SAP Event Mesh) and bind it to your SAP_COM_0092 configuration.

Add outbound topic bindings for sales order events.,

  • sap/s4/beh/salesorder/v1/SalesOrder/Created/v1

Event Mesh subscription
On SAP Event Mesh, ensure your queue (e.g., salesOrderQueue) subscribes to the exact topics above (or a safe wildcard such as sap/s4/beh/salesorder/v1/SalesOrder/*/v1).

Test and integrate
Create or update a Sales Order to ensure messages are received in the queue. Use SAP Cloud Integration with the AMQP adapter to consume messages, then call OData to fetch the complete Sales Order payload as needed.

Below are some useful SAP Documentation

S/4HANA Cloud Business Event Handling (SAP_COM_0092) ‚Äì scope & setup (Help Portal)

Enterprise Event Enablement in S/4HANA Cloud ‚Äì channels & outbound topic bindings (Help Portal)

SAP Event Mesh ‚Äì queues, subscriptions, and topic wildcards (Help Portal)

SAP Cloud Integration ‚Äì AMQP adapter guide (Help Portal)

Best regards,
Chuma

entry.title: Re: Dunning per Mail/Printing only if there is no Mail-Ad...
entry.content:
Hi @FabianSCC

 

Thanks for sharing the screenshot.

The Conditions Fields dropdown is not shown automatically. In your screen look just above the decision table. There in the dropdown you should have a + Add Condition Field. Once you click it, you will get a list of available condition fields. From there, select Default Email Address. This will add a new column into your table where you can then use ‚Äúis initial‚Äù and ‚Äúis not initial‚Äù. Without adding the condition field first, the system only shows the generic columns, which is why your rules don‚Äôt behave as expected.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP GRC for SAP HANA - Early Adopter Care Program is Open!
entry.content:
Ready to Shape the Future of SAP GRC for SAP HANA?

The Early Adopter Care (EAC) Program for SAP GRC for SAP HANA (GRC 2026) is now open!

This is an opportunity to gain early access to SAP‚Äôs latest innovations in governance, risk, and compliance (GRC), which include:

  • SAP Access Control
  • SAP Process Control
  • SAP Risk Management
  • SAP Audit Management
  • SAP Business Integrity Screening
  • SAP Tax Compliance
  • SAP UI Data Protection Masking
  • SAP UI Data Protection Logging

As a participant, you‚Äôll be among the first to implement and provide feedback on SAP GRC for SAP HANA before general availability.

This program is run in close collaboration with SAP experts, giving you direct access to development teams and dedicated support as you modernize compliance processes on SAP S/4HANA.

 

What‚Äôs in it for you?

  • Early access to SAP GRC for SAP HANA innovations
  • Close collaboration with SAP Development to minimize risks and safeguard projects
  • Dedicated feedback channel with product experts and project coaches
  • Visibility into who is adopting the newest GRC capabilities

entry.title: Re: Issue with Cost Center linked to incorrect Profit Cen...
entry.content:
Hello @Mike_vanIngen,

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, a cost center can only be linked to one profit center for its validity period. Once postings exist, you cannot reassign it, which is why you see the error Cost center has different profit centers. The supported approach is to end-date the incorrect cost center and create a new one with the correct profit center.

To keep reporting intact, add both cost centers to the same node in Manage Global Hierarchies - Cost Center Hierarchy so they roll up together. In external systems, you can map both IDs to the same ‚Äúlocation‚Äù ID.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Purchase order Percentage Price Condition on Purchase...
entry.content:
Hi @Phil_P

Yes, I can. In the SOAP Purchase Order API SAP_COM_0238, percentage-based conditions must be passed in the field <ConditionRateValue>, and you must configure the condition type with calculation type A which is percentage in your pricing procedure. You should not use <ConditionQuantityuntcode = %>, this is why you are seeing 0.00.

The following is an example of a 10% condition:

<PricingCondition>

     <ContitionType>ZRZ1</ConditionType>

     <ConditionRateValue>10</ConditionRateValue>

</PricingCondition>

This creates a 10% surcharge or discount. The <ConditionCurrency> field is not required for percentage conditions. Make sure your Z-condition in customising is defined with calculation type = A

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Get started with SAP Databricks: Users and roles
entry.content:
**Updated September 2025**

Welcome to our blog series focused on SAP Databricks. 

This specific post provides a comprehensive, step-by-step approach to help you:

  • Add users to SAP Databricks tenant (A)
  • Remove users from the tenant (B)
  • Assign users to workspaces (C)
  • Remove users from workspaces (D)

This blog series has 9 parts as follows: 

  • Get started with SAP Databricks: Introduction
  • Get started with SAP Databricks: Provisioning of SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) in SAP for Me
  • Get started with SAP Databricks: Provisioning of SAP Databricks account
  • Get started with SAP Databricks: Users and roles (this post) 
  • Get started with SAP Databricks: Workspace creation (coming soon)
  • Get started with SAP Databricks: Identity management and permissions (coming soon)
  • Get started with SAP Databricks: Networking and security (coming soon)
  • Get started with SAP Databricks: Connect to external data sources (coming soon)
  • Get started with SAP Databricks: Monitor consumption in SAP Databricks (coming soon)

Requirements: You must be an account admin or workspace admin to manage (add, remove, or edit) users.

Good to know: 

  • Email is the user identifier.
  • Users must be added to the SAP Databricks tenant before they can be assigned to workspaces.
  • SAP recommends using SAP Cloud Identity Services to create, assign, and synchronize users and groups, enabling efficient access management and role customization.
  • User deactivation is not supported.
  • You can create groups to quickly assign multiple people to a workspace.

Default roles in SAP Databricks

  • User: Can access the SAP Databricks tenant but not manage workspaces, data, user access or compute resources.
  • Workspace user: Can access the assigned workspace. Depending on the workspace entitlements, this role may also include access to Data Engineering, ML, and SQL environments.
  • Account admin: Manage users in the SAP Databricks tenant and workspaces, and configure data access.
  • Workspace admin: Manages users and controls access to objects and functionality within the assigned SAP Databricks workspace.

A) How to add new users to SAP Databricks:

1. Log in your SAP Databricks account and select "Manage account".

2. Click "Users & groups" card.

3. Click "Add user".

4. Add the new user email and full name and click "Add user".

5. The new user is created.

6. (Opcional) If you want this user to be an account admin, click "Roles".

7. (Opcional) Check the box for account admin. 

B) How to remove users from SAP Databricks:

1. Log in your SAP Databricks account and select "Manage account".

2. Click "Users & groups" card.

3. Select the user you want to remove. 

4. Press the three dots and click "Delete user". 

5. Press "Confirm delete" in the pop up.

6. The user is removed. 

C) How to add users to SAP Databricks workspace:

1. Log in your SAP Databricks account and select "Manage account".

2. Click "Workspaces".

3. Select the workspace you want to add the user. If you hasn't created the workspace yet, follow this guide (coming soon). 

4. Click "Permissions". 

5. Select "Add permissions". 

6. Type the user you want to add, then choose if you want it to have an user role or admin and click "Save". 

7. The user is assigned to the workspace. 

D) How to remove users from SAP Databricks workspace:

1. Log in your SAP Databricks account and select "Manage account".

2. Click "Workspaces".

3. Select the workspace you want to remove the user.

4. Click "Permissions". 

5. Press the three dots from the user you want to delete and click "Remove". 

6. Press "Remove" in the pop up.

7. The user is removed from the workspace. 

Sources:

  • SAP Databricks > Admin guide > Manage users

entry.title: Re: Fixed Asset ‚Äì Post Asset Acquisition API not posting...
entry.content:
Hi @arjun123 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Units of Measurement (UoM) & Fixed Asset ‚Äì Post Asset Acquisition  for more details.

To summarise, the inconsistency comes from how the API and the Fiori app handle decimal validation. The API performs a strict check against the Unit of Measure definition. In your case, UoM FOT is defined with 0 decimal places allowed. Therefore, the API rejects decimal inputs. The Fiori app, however, accepts decimal and silently truncates them before passing to the backend, which is why you can post manually.

You can resolve this by:

  • Adjusting the UoM definition for FOT to allow decimal places if fractional quantities are truly required.
  • Or you can round your API payload to integers in line with the UoM definition.
  • If you believe the app and API should behave consistently, you have the option to log an SAP support incident with Asset Accounting component and reference the API and app behaviour difference.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Update the status to ‚ÄúSent to bank‚Äù in the Monitor Pa...
entry.content:
Hello @Antony_Pantoja 

You‚Äôre close. In S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, those Monitor Payments statuses are not set by customising they are driven by integration steps. Here‚Äôs what actually updates them

Sent to Bank, set when S/4 knows the payment file has been successfully sent to the bank or the connector. In the Public Cloud, this is triggered by an inbound status call via the Finance Bank Connectivity Integration communication scenario SAP_COM_0256 or, if you use MBC, by its auto-feedback. If no status is returned, the batch remains in Approved. 
SAP Support Portal- KBA 3285645 - Batch status in app Monitor Payments 

The process is marked as' completed upon the batch reaching its final state, typically following bank status or acknowledgement messages PAIN.002 and/or when the bank statement confirms the payments. In the absence of status feedback or statement updates, the process will not transition to Completed 
SAP Support Portal KBA 2763473 - PAIN.002 received in MBC not updated in Monitor Payments 

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: The description of the cost center are not displayed.
entry.content: In fact, many SAP fiori apps don't retrieve data based on the local time setting, leaving many users confused about what data is being retrieved. One such example is the cost center standard hierarchy within the global hierarchy. It's unclear whether the query is based on system time or the local time setting. Users may conclude this is a system error. I believe SAP should apply the local time setting to all apps.

entry.title: Re: Adding custom condition types to calculation schema f...
entry.content:
Good day @TS01 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Extensibility for Purchase Order Apps & Retrieve Pricing from SAP S/4HANA for more details.

To summarise, the calculation schema for purchasing info records AXX001 is fixed and cannot be replaced by a custom Z schema in public cloud. Unlike on-premise, there is not customising point where you can assign your own schema to info records.

Public Cloud supports the extiosion of the existing schema by adding your cusom condition types through the Manage Your Solution --> Configure Price Management for Purchasing SSCUI. This way, your Z-conditions can be included in the price determination for info records but the schema itself remains AXX001.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: The amount of activity type is not correct and how to...
entry.content:
Hello @garyding 

Thanks for the clear screenshots. This appears to be a classic mix of rate determination/date/currency versus secondary cost element clearing. Here‚Äôs how to nail both. It shows 360 because the timesheet used the 45/hour rate that was active for that date (not the intended 100) ‚Äî 8h √ó 45 = 360. Update the valid-on rate to 100/hour and confirm the report is in USD so that 8 hours post are 800.

Additionally, double-check the Valid On date and rate priority in Manage Cost Rates ‚Äì Services. A more specific linel with Receiving Company, WBS Element, or Service Cost Level) can override your 100/hour rate and apply a 45/hour rate. In Projects . Actuals, set Display Currency = Company Code Currency (USD) to rule out currency conversion; and for secondary cost element 94308100, make sure the sender and receiver are in the same company code (or use the intercompany process) so the debit/credit nets to zero at month-end.

Let me know if you need further information

Wuth regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Activate Account Assignment Objects Configuration for...
entry.content:
Good day @EvelynL 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at SAP S/4HANA Cloud : Asset Accounting - FAQs & Scope Items for Asset Accounting-J62 for more details.

To summarise, in Public Cloud, the IMG option for Asset Accounting is not available. In Cloud, depreciation posting is always made to the cost center assigned to the asset master record. Direct posting of depreciations to a WBS element is not supported either.

If you want project-related depreciation, the supported process is to acquire assets under construction to a WBS element, then settle to a final asset. Depreciation itself, however, will still be posted to the cost center. Any reporting by WBS needs to be handled through settlement or reporting extensions.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Update the status to ‚ÄúSent to bank‚Äù in the Monitor Pa...
entry.content:
Hello @Indra123e 

Thank you for your question.

The following link https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/4f22209d1f5d4bd79c4a55017608b51b/f8f29bb9d08a418d936ce5de8a78b33f.html?locale=en-US will provide more details.

To summarise, in Public Cloud, the statuses sent to bank and completed in the monitor payment app are updated only via Bank Communication Management or through payment status feedback APIs. If Bank Communication Management is not used, you must integrate through API_BANK_PAYMENT_STATUS_NOTIFICATION or an equivalent status update API from your middleware. When the bank confirms receipt or settlement, Middleware should call this API to update the status in cloud.

There is no custom Logic or BAdI available in public cloud to manually update these statuses. Manual change is neither supported. The only supported approach is to enable the return integration flow from bank √† Middleware√† Cloud.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Description" field
entry.content:
Good day @mohamed_ezakraoui37 

Thank you for your question.

To summarise, in public cloud, the recommended way to make the PO item Description field read-only is through Adapt UI. Here you can select the Description field in the purchase order app and set it to Read-Only for your business role. This prevents your users from editing the field in the UI.

If you also need strict backend control, you can additionally implement a validation BAdI (for example, MM_PUR_S4_PO_VALIDATE) to check whether the Description field has been changed and raise an error. Custom Fields and Logic does not apply here because the filed is a standard field and not a custom one.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Multiple stock types (Avail.Grps with different stora...
entry.content:
Hi @SAPSupport 

Thank you for your question.

Consult The SAP Extended Warehouse Management FAQ Series: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Integration for more details.

To summarise, it is technically possible to store multiple stock types in the same bin in public cloud, but the ROD/AFS best practice assumes separate handling and a posting change WT to release stock for use. Currently, there is no released BAdI to dynamically change stock type during WT confirmation in public cloud.

Your options are therefore limited to:

  1. Follow the best practice flow (ROD BIN √†posting change WT √† AFS bin), or
  2. To configure bin types to allow mixed stock types, with the trade-off that ROD and AFS stock may coexist in the same bin. If you want to skip posting change, you can design alternative WPTs, but that will deviate from the best practice process.

You cannot enhance through custom BAdI in public cloud today. Only standard released BadIs in WM business context is available, and stock type change at WT confirmation is not one of them.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Wear Monitoring Measurement Maintenance Plans/Counters
entry.content:
Hi,

I'm trying to establish a maintenance plan based on a wear measurement reading where I want a WO to generate once the wear measurement hits or passes 180 (daily readings are taken and recording as a counter Measuring Point in SAP).  Readings will continue to be taken, sometimes as high as 225 as the timing of the actual change out can fluctuate depending on operational needs.   

The solution I had come up with was to do a counter change out and zero the counter readings (including the total) at each change out work order, however this is affecting the maintenance plan as (after the initial generation at 180) it is looking for a measurement reading of 360 to trigger the next change out.  Without having to reset the Maintenance Plan at each change out, can I set it to trigger at a reading of 180, rather than 180, 360, 720 etc)?

The reason for zeroing the total counter also is that depending on when the change out is done (i.e. 180 or 195 or 225 or any number in between) the trigger points of 360, 720 etc become increasingly out of alignment when the values being recorded daily.

Or let me know how you would set this up if I've approached it incorrectly.

Thank you.

entry.title: üö¶Preventable GoLive Issues in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
A strategic initiative to mitigate predictable risks and elevate the maturity of S/4HANA Cloud ERP projects.

Introduction

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition implementation projects, it is common to observe that certain GoLive issues do not arise from technical gaps but rather from recurring shortcomings in communication, governance, or risk anticipation. Although many of these failures are well known, their recurrence continues to jeopardize timelines, effort, and the customer experience.

With this in mind, the initiative ‚ÄúPreventable GoLive Issues‚Äù was designed to focus on preventing both well-documented recurring risks and less obvious, yet equally critical ones. The central goal is to support SAP partners and customers in actively preventing errors during production cutover by using a data-driven approach, functional categorization, and business impact assessment.

Solution Structure

  • The initiative is delivered through a simple yet strategic Excel spreadsheet, structured with the following columns:

This structure enables:

  • Classification of issues by functional area (e.g., Finance, Supply Chain, Purchasing, Integration, Automation, etc.);
  • Recording of specific occurrences by country, addressing local nuances;
  • Detailed description of each error, enabling immediate recognition in similar projects;
  • Objective recommendations for resolution, based on real-world experience;
  • Estimation of GoLive impact, serving as a prioritization criterion.

Strategic Objective

To empower implementation ecosystems ‚Äî both partners and customers ‚Äî with a structured repository of known and atypical risks, driving safer, more predictable GoLives aligned with SAP best practices.

This initiative is fully aligned with the principles of SAP Activate, Clean Core, and Continuous Quality, serving as an additional layer of preventive intelligence within the project lifecycle.

Expected Benefits

  • Reduction of rework and post-GoLive incidents;
  • Standardization of deliverables based on documented real-world failures;
  • Acceleration of quality and validation cycles in QAS;
  • Improved governance and traceability of preventable risks;
  • Enhanced learning curve for future projects;
  • Attention to local or regional specificities.

Target Audience

This tool was specifically designed for:

  • Project Leaders (PMO): seeking to increase delivery maturity;
  • SAP Solution Architects: aiming to accelerate risk detection before cutover;
  • Quality Assurance teams (QA): in need of inputs to prevent systemic failures;
  • Executives (CxOs): looking for safety and predictability in digital transformation initiatives.

Failure is Not Technical, but Human

  • ERP implementation problems are rarely caused by system errors ‚Äî they are usually tied to poor adoption and user engagement due to lack of trust, skills, or commitment;
  • Change management is just as critical as the technical side;
  • Even if technical issues can be solved, cultural resistance may persist for years, compromising ERP benefits if not managed properly from the beginning.

Leadership Commitment is Key

  • Change must start at the top ‚Äî if top management does not value or use the ERP, others will not follow. Consistent communication and visible executive support are essential.

People, Not Systems, Create Real Value

  • Technology is merely a tool. True ROI comes from effective user adoption; without it, there are no real business gains.

Recommendations

  1. Focus on adoption: prioritize strategies to ensure users consistently use the ERP correctly.
  2. Leadership engagement: ensure executives are the first to use, promote, and reinforce ERP value.
  3. Invest in communication and training: prepare people to change behaviors through adequate training, coaching, and recognition.
  4. Maintain post-implementation support: continue assistance, listen to feedback, measure adoption, and adjust as needed.

Conclusion

The GoLive of an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition solution should be a milestone of achievement ‚Äî not a moment of stress. Prevention is always cheaper than correction.

This initiative provides a practical, collaborative, and intelligent approach to transforming lessons learned into replicable and scalable actions across the SAP ecosystem.

entry.title: Re: How to allow a Partner Account to receive SAP notific...

Hi JEAHYO,

Regarding your inquiry of "Could you please tell me if there is a way to enable the partner to receive these notification emails?", please note that within Systems & Provisioning - SAP for Me, you can only enable S-users associated with your company to receive SAP cloud notifications. It is not possible to allow a partner to receive SAP notifications for an end customer. 

If you wish, you can also submit your enhancement request through the Feedback channel, as outlined in KBA 3156721 - How to give feedback or share ideas and requirements - SAP for Me .The feedback will be sent to the product team, who will review the customer feedback/requirements on a regular basis.
